alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 15 at 3:26PM HST until February 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING FOR BIG ISLAND SUMMITS FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... .A kona low is expected to bring deep moisture over the Big Island beginning Thursday morning, continuing through at least Saturday. Temperatures near or below freezing over the summits will result in the potential for the development of heavy snow, with strong and gusty winds leading to periods of near-zero visibility in heavy precipitation. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 6 PM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...From 6 AM Thursday to 6 PM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times, with periods of zero visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are also possible. This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. Any travel plans to the summits should be postponed until the threat diminishes.
